Package org.hiphap

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hiphap.Event
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Arrangement
    public class Event
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents within the system a singular event organized by HipHapOrg on behalf of one or more clients.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter DT_FORMAT
      A DateTimeFormatter object to help with writing to and parsing from a String representation of any particular LocalDateTime, to keep formatting consistent.
      protected java.util.ArrayList<EventResource> eventResources
      An ArrayList that holds all the EventResource objects that represent all the goods and services to be purchased/hired for the event.
      protected EventType eventType
      A EventType representation of the category that this event falls under.
      protected java.time.LocalDateTime finish
      A LocalDateTime representation of the event's ending date and time.
      protected User hipHapOrganizer
      The User that created and maintains this event.
      protected java.lang.String location
      A String representation of the location where the event takes place.
      protected java.lang.String name
      A String representation of this event's name.
      protected java.util.LinkedHashMap<Entity,​java.lang.Boolean> organizers
      A LinkedHashMap that holds the event's organizers and associates each of them to a flag representing whether they wish to receive notifications from the system.
      protected java.util.LinkedHashMap<Entity,​java.lang.Boolean> participants
      A LinkedHashMap that holds the event's participants and associates each of them to a flag representing whether they wish to receive notifications from the system.
      protected java.util.LinkedHashMap<Employee,​java.lang.Double> staff
      A LinkedHashMap that holds all the HipHapOrg Employees that have been hired to work at this particular event.
      protected java.time.LocalDateTime start
      A LocalDateTime representation of the event's starting date and time.

    • Field Detail

      • name

        protected java.lang.String name
        A String representation of this event's name. Should never be null or blank.

      • start

        protected java.time.LocalDateTime start
        A LocalDateTime representation of the event's starting date and time. Can be null

      • finish

        protected java.time.LocalDateTime finish
        A LocalDateTime representation of the event's ending date and time. Can be null

      • location

        protected java.lang.String location
        A String representation of the location where the event takes place. Usually meant to hold the actual street address. Can be blank.

      • eventType

        protected EventType eventType
        A EventType representation of the category that this event falls under. eg. Wedding, Party, etc. Can be blank.

      • organizers

        protected java.util.LinkedHashMap<Entity,​java.lang.Boolean> organizers
        A LinkedHashMap that holds the event's organizers and associates each of them to a flag representing whether they wish to receive notifications from the system.

      • participants

        protected java.util.LinkedHashMap<Entity,​java.lang.Boolean> participants
        A LinkedHashMap that holds the event's participants and associates each of them to a flag representing whether they wish to receive notifications from the system.

      • eventResources

        protected java.util.ArrayList<EventResource> eventResources
        An ArrayList that holds all the EventResource objects that represent all the goods and services to be purchased/hired for the event.

      • staff

        protected java.util.LinkedHashMap<Employee,​java.lang.Double> staff
        A LinkedHashMap that holds all the HipHapOrg Employees that have been hired to work at this particular event. Associated with each is a Double representation of the number of hours they are scheduled to work.

      • hipHapOrganizer

        protected User hipHapOrganizer
        The User that created and maintains this event.

      • DT_FORMAT

        public static final java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter DT_FORMAT
        A DateTimeFormatter object to help with writing to and parsing from a String representation of any particular LocalDateTime, to keep formatting consistent.

      • getEventResources

        public java.util.ArrayList<EventResource> getEventResources​(java.lang.String name)
        Get an ArrayList of the EventResource objects associated with this event that also contain a String in their name.
        Parameters:
        name - the String to check against in the names
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of matching EventResource objects

      • getResourcesCost

        public java.lang.Double getResourcesCost()
        Get the cost as Double of all the EventResource objects associated with this event.
        Returns:
        the total cost of all EventResource objects associated with this event

      • getHipHapFee

        public java.lang.Double getHipHapFee()
        Get the fee that HipHapOrg will charge for organizing this event. This is calculated as 5% of the total EventResource objects cost, with a minimum of 1000 kr.
        Returns:
        a Double representation of HipHapOrg's organization fee

      • getStaffCost

        public java.lang.Double getStaffCost()
        Get the total cost of all the HipHapOrg staff hired for this event, based on each Employee's hourly rate and the scheduled number of hours.
        Returns:

      • getTotalEventCost

        public java.lang.Double getTotalEventCost()
        Get a grand total of this event's cost.
        Returns:
        a Double representation of this event's total cost

      • addStaff

        public void addStaff​(Employee employee,
                     java.lang.Double numHours)
        Add an Employee to the list of staff hired to work at this event.
        Parameters:
        employee - the Employee to be added.
        numHours - a Double representation of the number of hours the Employee to be added is scheduled to work at this event

      • deleteStaff

        public boolean deleteStaff​(Employee employee)
        Remove an Employee from the list of staff hired to work at this event.

        Returns:
        the ArrayList of the staff hired to work at this event

      • getHours

        public java.lang.Double getHours​(Employee employee)
        Get the number of hours a particular Employee is scheduled to work at this event.
        Parameters:
        employee - the Employee whose scheduled number of hours are to be returned
        Returns:
        a Double representation of the number of hours the Employee is scheduled to work. Can return null if Employee object is not found within the staff collection

      • setHours

        public void setHours​(Employee employee,
                     double numHours)
        Set the number of hours a particular Employee is scheduled to work at this event. If the Employee is not found, a new entry is added to the collection.
        Parameters:
        employee - the Employee whose scheduled working hours are to be set
        numHours - the number of hours the Employee is scheduled to work

      • isWorking

        public boolean isWorking​(Employee employee)
        Check whether a particular employee is scheduled to work at this event.
        Parameters:
        employee - the Employee to search for
        Returns:
        true if the Employee has been found in the collection

      • setHipHapOrganizer

        public void setHipHapOrganizer​(User hipHapOrganizer)

      • getHipHapOrganizer

        public User getHipHapOrganizer()

      • isScheduleOverlap

        public boolean isScheduleOverlap​(Event event)
        Checks whether this event's schedule overlaps with another event's schedule. It checks the actual times only if both starting and ending times are set for both events. If either event is missing the finishing time, it only checks if the starting dates are the same. Furthermore, if either event is also missing a start date, it always returns null.
        Parameters:
        event - the event against which to check starting and ending dates/times
        Returns:
        true if there is an overlap in the events' schedules
